quiz.text: The balls of box Q and S are mixed and two balls are drawn randomly then find the probability of getting at least one Blue ball?
options: 36/95
72/85
12/95
24/95
None of these

quiz.text: Number of White balls in box P, S and T together is approximate what percent less/more than the number of white balls in Q and R together?
options: 20%
15%
10%
33.33%
None of these

quiz.text: All Green and White balls from all the boxes are taken and put in the new box A and then two balls are drawn randomly then find the probability of getting different color balls?
options: 1624/3665
1624/3655
1624/3565
1642/3565
1642/3655

quiz.text: If one third of Red ball is taken from box Q and mixed in box T and three balls are taken randomly from box T, then find the probability that the balls are not Green?
options: 287/602
589/602
286/602
569/602
471/602

quiz.text: Four balls are taken out from box S then find the probability of getting all different color balls?
options: 81/1309
81/1390
81/1308
81/1049
None of these

quiz.text: A container contains 26 yellow, 6 red, 13 green, and 19 pink marbles. 20 marbles are added to the container randomly. The numbers of added yellow marbles are __________ if the chance of choosing a yellow marble out of the container becomes 0.5.
options: 10
12
18
20
16

quiz.text: Ram has 2 baskets of fruits from which the first basket contain 6 oranges and 7 mangoes. And the second basket contains 5 oranges and 8 mangoes. If one fruit is to drawn out from either of the two baskets then the probability of drawing a mango is _________?
options: 15/25
15/26
15/22
16/23
16/26

quiz.text: As return gifts heena makes 4 pouches having 3 colored pencils and 4 erasers and 3 pouches having 5 colored pencils and 3 erasers. If a kid grabs one eraser from the pouch then the probability of it being from second set of pouch is __________.
options: 5 / 392
63 / 191
29 / 191
1 / 392
18 / 191

quiz.text: A bag contains 4 red balls, 6 blue balls and 8 pink balls. One ball is drawn at random and add 3 pink balls without replacement. A second ball was drawn. The probability that the first ball drawn was either red or blue in color and the second ball drawn was pink in color is __________.
options: 12/21
13/17
11/30
13/18
None of these

quiz.text: A bag contains 5 red balls, 7 yellow balls and 8 green balls. 3 balls are drawn randomly. The probability that the balls drawn contain balls of different colours is _______.
options: 17/57
19/57
14/57
23/57
None of these

quiz.text: What is the probability of eating up a Rasgulla out of a Diwali gift box? Statement I:  There are 5 Kaju katli and 7 Milk cake in a Diwali box with some other sweets Statement II: In Diwali sweets box 3 sweets are not Rasgulla. Statement III:  There are 32 Rasgulla in a diwali box with no kaju katli.
options: Statement I and II are sufficient to answer the question.
Statement II and III are sufficient to answer the question.
Any two statements are sufficient to answer the question.
All the statements together are not sufficient to answer the question.
All the statements together are required to answer the question.

quiz.text: A committee having 2 Hindi teachers and 2 English teachers is to be formed from some ‘Hindi teachers’ and ‘English teachers’. The probability of doing so is 3/5. Find the total number of Hindi and English teachers. Statement I: Number of ways to choose 2 teachers out of total teachers is 15 Statement II: Number of ways to choose 2 Hindi teachers out of total Hindi teachers is 3 Statement III: Number of English teachers is 3
options: Statement (I) alone is sufficient
Statement (II) alone is sufficient
Statement (III) alone is sufficient
Each of the statements alone is sufficient
Statement (II) and (III) together are sufficient

quiz.text: A bag contains some number of Diamond of 4 different colors (Red, Pink, blue and yellow). What is the total number of Diamond in the bag? I. If 5 Pink Diamond from the bag are replaced by Yellow Diamond, Then the ratio of probabilities of picking 2 yellow Diamond at a time to picking 3 Blue Diamond at a time becomes (1/116). II. The different between probabilities of picking 2 Red Diamonds at a time and probability of picking 2 Blue Diamonds at a time is (23/330). III. If a Diamond is picked from the bag, then there is 40% chance that it is a red Diamond. Probability of picking 2 Red Diamond from the bag is (26/165).
options: The data in only statement I and II together are sufficient to answer the question.
The data in only statement I and III together are sufficient to answer the question.
The data in only statement III alone is sufficient to answer the question.
The data in at least any two of the 3 statements is necessary to answer the question.
None of these.

quiz.text: A bag contains a total of (x + 5) balls of three colours of Blue, Pink and Red such that the ratio of number of Pink and Red balls is 3 : 2 resp. and the probability of drawing a Blue ball is 2/5. Find the number of balls in the bag. I: Probability of drawing a Pink ball is (9/25). II: The number of Blue balls in the bag is 8 more than the number of Red balls.
options: Only I alone
Only II alone
Either I or II
Both I and II
Neither I or II

quiz.text: A bag contains a total of (x + 5) balls of three colours of Blue, Pink and Red such that the ratio of number of Pink and Red balls is 3 : 2 resp. and the probability of drawing a Blue ball is 2/5. Find the number of pink balls. I: Probability of drawing a Pink ball is (9/25). II: The number of Blue balls in the bag is 8 more than the number of Red balls.
options: Only I alone
Only II alone
Either I or II
Both I and II
Neither I or II

quiz.text: Quantity A: In a pack of cards, one card is drawn, find the probability of the drawn card, if it is black or ‘10’? Quantity B: 7/13
options: Quantity A ≥ Quantity B
Quantity A ≤ Quantity B
Quantity A < Quantity B
Quantity A > Quantity B
Quantity A = Quantity B or No relation

quiz.text: There are 50 cards in a box numbered from 1 to 50. One number is written on each card. A card is drawn from the box.   Quantity I: Find the probability that the drawn card is a multiple of both 2 and 4. Quantity II: Find the probability that the drawn card is an odd prime number.
options: Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≤ Quantity: II
Quantity: II = Quantity: I
Quantity I > Quantity II

quiz.text: Quantity I: The probability of getting Ace from a well-shuffled pack of cards when one card is picked randomly. Quantity II: The probability of getting jack from a well-shuffled pack of cards when one card is picked randomly.
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≤ Quantity: II
Quantity I = Quantity II

quiz.text: Quantity I: All aces and Jacks are removed from the pack of 52 cards. One card is drawn randomly from the pack. Find the probability that the card is King. Quantity II: There are 25 pink balloons and 30 Red Balloons are there in a box. Two balloons are selected randomly. Find the probability that they are of the same color.
options: Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≤ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: II < Quantity: I
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: There are three bags A, B, and C. In each bag, there are three colored balls Pink, Red, and grey.In bag A, the number of Red balls is 4 more than the number of Pink balls. When one ball is picked at random then the probability of getting Grey is 1/3. Pink balls are  less than Red balls. In bag B, the number of Pink balls is 50% more than the number of Pink balls in bag A. If two balls are picked at random from bag B then the probability of getting both Grey color balls is 5/126. The total number of balls in bag B is 28. In bag C, the ratio of the number of red balls and the number of Grey ball is 5: 4. The total number of Red balls and grey balls are 27. If one ball is picked at random then the probability of getting the Pink ball is 7/16. Quantity I: Total number of balls in bag A Quantity II: Total number of red balls in bag B Quantity III: Total number of balls in bag C
options: Quantity I > Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I = Quantity II = Quantity III

quiz.text: In a factory, toys are manufactured, out of which some are defected. Toys are packed in a box. Three toys are picked from box by inspector. if two of the toys out of three are perfect, box passes otherwise it fails. Find the probability of box getting passed.
options: 0.25
0.5
0.75
0.35
0.85

quiz.text: In a container, there are 6 red marbles, blue marbles are (100/3)% more than red marbles and green marbles are 25% less than blue marbles. Two marbles are drawn without replacement. If the first marble comes out to be green, then 50% of the red marbles are also taken out of the container. Find the probability that first marble is green and second is red?
options: 3/13
9/160
5/17
7/130
1/2

quiz.text: When a student was selected from a class consisting of 20 girls and some boys the probability of the student being a girl is 2/5. If 2 students are selected from the same class, what is the probability of them being both girls or both boys?
options: 21/49
23/49
25/49
27/49
None of these

quiz.text: Ram and Shyam participate in coin toss. Both of them are given a coin and they toss it simultaneously. If Ram lands a heads and Shyam tails, Ram wins and vice versa. If they both land heads or tails, nobody wins. Given that their coin lands different sides, find the probability of Ram’s winning?
options: 1 / 2
1 / 4
3 / 4
2 / 3
None of these

quiz.text: Five persons enter a lift on the ground floor of an eight-floor apartment. Assuming that each of them independently and with equal probability can leave the lift on any floor beginning with the first, what is the probability that all the five persons are leaving the lift on different floors?
options: 7P5/76
7P5/75
7P3/75
7P6/76
7P5/74
